CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority
CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice without call for competition

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Ministry of Defence, Ships, Underwater and Electronic Warfare

ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: Ministry of Defence, Ships, Underwater and Electronic Warfare

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: UEW/015 — Magazine Torpedo Launch System (MTLS) Technical Refresh and In Service Support of Seagnat, Air Weapons Handling Equipment and MTLS (SAM)

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: The Defence Equipment and Support (DE&S) Underwater electronic warfare (UEW) Delivery team (DT) is considering a full technical refresh and modernisation of the Magazine Torpedo Launch System (MTLS) control system in 8 x T23 frigates (including the production of manufacture data packs and an update to test and training facilities and guidance) with the option of completing the technical refresh for a further 5 ships (potential 13 ships in total), to resolve obsolescence.

MTLS is a ship-borne anti-submarine torpedo launching system which deploys Sting Ray torpedo against sub-surface threats. It is expected that the update should deliver at least the same capability as the currently fitted MTLS and should operate within current ship definition.

The UEW DT is also considering the in-service support, including spares availability, for the newly acquired technical refreshed MTLS control system for 5 years, with the option of extending for up to a further 2 years. The support package should also include the support for Seagnat and Air Weapons Handling Equipment.
The expected contract award date is June 2021. Please note this date may be subject to change. The total value of the contract is expected to range from 7 000 000 GBP-15 000 000 GBP.

This Prior Information Notice (PIN) has been issued in order to better understand the market, the authority is inviting interested parties to provide details on their capabilities in this field. This PIN is not a means to seek formal expressions of interest; that opportunity may become available in the future through a contract notice published on Defence contracts online and the Official Journal of the European Union. If you are interested in this requirement, please send an email to the point of contact referenced in this notice. Your email shall be no longer than 300 words and shall provide evidence of your capability to deliver the requirement. This information will not be used to down select suppliers, that will be conducted via a pre-qualification questionnaire once the contract notice has been published. Any information provided will be kept confidential.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: The authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy. If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a security aspects letter), the authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise. The link below to the Gov.uk website provides information on the Government Security Classification.
Advertising Regime OJEU: this contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU), the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk
Suppliers must read through this set of instructions and follow the process to respond to this opportunity.
The information and/or documents for this opportunity are available on http://www.contracts.mod.uk.

You must register on this site to respond, if you are already registered you will not need to register again, simply use your existing username and password. Please note there is a password reminder link on the homepage.
Suppliers must log in, go to your response manager and add the following access code: 62X33R2S6Y.
Please ensure you follow any instruction provided to you here.

The deadline for submitting your response(s) is detailed within this contract notice, you will also have visibility of the deadline date, once you have added the access code via DCO as the opening and closing date is visible within the opportunity.
Please ensure that you allow yourself plenty of time when responding to this opportunity prior to the closing date and time, especially if you have been asked to upload documents.

If you experience any difficulties please refer to the online Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ's) or the User Guides or contact the MOD DCO Helpdesk by emailing: support@contracts.mod.uk or Tel. 0800 282 324.
